body.description: Powered by AMD Ryzen AM4 processors, the MSI B550M PRO-VDH WIFI combines stable functionality and high-quality assembly to solve professional workflows. Extended Heatsink Design and Core boost keep critical components operating reliably. PCIe 4.0 slots and M.2 with Shield Frozr provides the latest in device connectivity.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: MSI is the most trusted name in gaming and eSports. We’ve dedicated countless hours and committed numerous resources to support the world’s most aspiring and best gamers and use their knowledge and expertise in our products in return. MSI integrated all gamer’s aspirational functions in its gaming rigs and pushing the performance beyond limits. B550M PRO-VDH WIFI Advancing Ascension Powered by AMD Ryzen AM4 processors, the MSI B550M PRO-VDH WIFI combines stable functionality and high-quality assembly to solve professional workflows. Support for 3rd Gen AMD Ryzen processors and future AMD Ryzen processors with BIOS update Supports dual channel DDR4 memory up to 128 GB (4400 MHz) Lightning Fast Game experience: PCIe 4.0, Lightning Gen 4 M.2 with M.2 Shield Frozr, AMD Turbo USB 3.2 GEN 2 Core Boost technology combines optimized power circuit layouts and digital power regulation which allows for precise and steady current delivery to the CPU AUDIO BOOST rewards your ears with studio grade sound quality for immersive gaming experiences Premium Thermal Solution: Heatsink thermal pad rated for 7W/mk and PCB with 2oz thickened copper Flash BIOS Button lets users flash the BIOS even without a CPU or memory

LIGHTNING GEN 4 SOLUTION Strike fast with MSI Lightning Gen 4 PCI-E. Attach ultra fast PCI-E 4.0 devices and enjoy up to 64GB/s unidirectional transfer bandwidth. DISPLAY OUTPUT FLEXIBILITY B550M PRO-VDH WIFI V - VGA D - DisplayPort H - HDMI PCB WITH 2OZ THICKENED COPPER An enhanced PCB material design with 2oz thickened copper increases conductivity, improving heat dissipation and high-performance reliability.

CORE BOOST Core Boost combines a reserved zone of optimized circuits and premium power delivery components to create a highly efficient power system capable of precise current output to the CPU. AUDIO BOOST Reward your ears with studio grade sound quality. MSI Audio Boost delivers the highest sound quality through the use of premium quality audio components. FORTIFY WITH PCI-E STEEL ARMOR MSI PCI Express Steel Armor slots are secured to the motherboard with extra solder points and support the weight of heavy graphics cards. When every advantage in games counts, Steel Armor shields the point of contact from electromagnetic interference.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Support 3 monitors with APU. 8 SATA for HDD/SSD. Avoid using drivers on MSI Centre.
reviews.reviewText: Great value for $110-ish! It supports 3 onboard connections to 3 monitors (HDMI, DisplayPort, and VGA), with an APU such as Ryzen 7 5700G. HDMI is 2.1, but DisplayPort is only 1.2, so check on your monitor's resolution. The motherboard comes with BIOS version 7C95vH8, so the BIOS does not need to be updated to support Ryzen 7 5700G. Version 7C95vH0 and above supports this CPU/APU.It supports up to 8 SATA storage devices, so it's great for future expansion on HDD or SSD. It works perfectly with a case like Phanteks Eclipse G500A (This case also provides front panel type-C USB connector to this board). Note that the M.2_1 slot support Gen3 PCIe SSD, unless your CPU/APU supports Gen4. Practically there is not much difference between Gen3 and Gen4 PCIe SSD anyways for either gaming or daily use. The compatibility list on the MSI website was last updated on FEB 2023, and the tech support is not very helpful on finding anything other than that list. The newer versions of DRAM should mostly be compatible, and you just have to plug them in and see if they pass the onboard EZ LED light debug checking sequence at booting. If so, then your DRAM is good to go.Caution: Do NOT install the B550 chipset drivers through the MSI Centre prompt! If you do it, it will mess up your system and make it not bootable. Then you'd have to restore the system to the last recovery point. Just go with the drivers on the MSI website (and the AMD website for your CPU/APU), and you are good to go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This motherboard is pretty great. I love the amount of connector slots there are on the sides. Its super easy to install all the components you need on this motherboard. It's pretty pleasing to look at too.Note that if you get this motherboard you will have to use an ethernet cable and/or a PCIE wifi adapter to be able to connect to the internet. If you are only gonna use wifi then get a wifi motherboard or the wifi version of this motherboard model.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good price, works well
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this after receiving a defective board from another brand. I was looking to upgrade from my B450 board to something that had USB 3.1 Gen 2 and PCIE 4.0. Received the package with zero problems and managed to flash an updated bios following instructions on YouTube. Everything loaded up properly without having to reinstall windows or make any changes outside of settings like XMP. Very happy with this board.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great tweaking board for the price
reviews.reviewText: Price is good for what you get. Offers Gen-4 M.2 storage and GPU speeds. MSI is good brand and delivers solid quality products.It doesn't offer AMD EXPO. I'm not sure if I worded that right, I'm new to the newer tech. But I have to manually set ram timing to 3600mhz instead of XMP doing it for me.But once you figure it out, it's a really nice peice of tech for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Enough features for what I need. Install was straightforward, although it would be nice if they provided mb /case standoffs--seems I'm always short. The one problem I had was finding and identifying some of the mb connectors, as the documentation was a bit weak. Hardest to find was the one that powers the rgb light on the CPU fan--not that I really need to bling up the case interior--like anyone would notice!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Motherboard is great, two M2 slots on a micro atx with wifi and bluetooth feels like a great deal at this price point.FOR WIFI AND BLUETOOTH FUNCTIONALITY you will need to install drivers from MSI, mine did not work or recognize until I completed this step.There are two ways to go about this.You can install the "MSI Centre" from the microsoft store. This program is insanely hard to navigate, and most people can't get past the terms and conditions. (You have to read it for continue to light up). The consensus is that it's junk but can't vouch past the terriible intro.OR, you can install Dragon Center. I went this route and it was pretty painless (search auto for drivers, install drivers, done). Just be careful not to update BIOS from dragon center or MSI center.. this has been known to cause problems on MSI motherboards. Always flash from a USB to be safe

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value for an mATX build
reviews.reviewText: This board has worked great for my PC build. Great value for the features it has.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fully featured with some issues
reviews.reviewText: I have a Living room PC I built with left over parts from my main PC build and it has a B450 board that lacks certain features, such as WiFi and a USB-C header for the front port on my case. This motherboard was fairly cheap and an upgrade so I went with it. Having built-in Bluetooth and WiFi is nice, it saved from having to use adapters.Installation was very easy but I'm disappointed at how low quality the IO shield is compared to my previous board, which had padding and was colored so you could see all the labels. The USB 3.0 header looked crooked but still works. The main M.2 slot gave me some issues with my boot drive not being detected. I thought at first that my drive had died but it would work in an enclosure. It would also work if I didn't use the heatsink. Turns out that the screw for the heatsink needed to be installed somewhat loose or it would bend the stick. After figuring that out, the drive was detected.I was able to boot into Windows without reinstalling and immediately got prompted to download some MSI drivers, which was convenient. Make sure to remember to remove the old motherboard's software and drivers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Me gustó bastante desde el primer momento, buena placa.
reviews.reviewText: Dentro de lo que cabe, me parece una mother bonita y con los puertos necesarios, además de tener wifi y bluetooth.

reviews.reviewTitle: Major upgrade to the b450m pro vdh max
reviews.reviewText: My b450m mobo did not survive my recent move and was likely damaged in transit. It was a thin board with a lot of flex. Was going to buy it again to replace the damaged one but saw this. The b550m is significantly thicker and more sturdy. I also get front I/O USB c and Wi-Fi/BT for $30 more than the b450m. No brainer upgrade for me. The heat sinks look a little more functional as well and there is even one for the nvme drive. I'm not an overclocker and actually prefer a small undervolt for my amd CPUs and I just use xmp, so I can't comment on how it handles overclocking. Great board for a mid to high end build, though.

This went into a budget build gaming PC, and is an excellent value for the money! I custom build PC's all the time and will always use MSI products. Have never had an issue with MSI and love their entire product line! Very easy to install, and very easy to add components. Was gaming in no time!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great card, but tricky to activate wifi
reviews.reviewText: I’m happy with this card. Everything works. Wifi is a bit tricky to activate, spent 2 hours figuring it out. I’ll save you some time. Basically what you have to do is initially connect to internet via Ethernet cable. From there download MSI Centre. Go to Support tab and then to Live Update. It will then list all the drivers that you’re missing (wifi, Bluetooth etc). Click update and you got your wifi

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Cutting-edge features; difficult to set up.
reviews.reviewText: I have a love/hate relationship with this mobo. Once it’s set up, it works like a dream!It comes with a very basic BIOS which doesn’t allow it to operate much at all. To get it up and running, you need to install the latest version of BIOS from a flash-drive. That means that you have to have access to a working computer that you can use to download the latest BIOS onto a flash-drive before you can upload it onto the mobo. It was a complicated process for this novice, but now that I’ve done it, not so very difficult after all!The next problem was that the mobo won’t access my old HDD’s because it operates UEFI protocol. According to the manual, which I had to download onto my phone (!), the protocol can be switched to accept other versions, but my initial attempts have been unsuccessful. I therefore had to download Windows onto a flash-drive, via another computer, and upload it onto the mobo.Because the mobo is cutting-edge, it has 2 iSSD ports. I had bought a 1TB iSSD as part of the build and the installation was fairly straightforward, but fiddley.And now the ‘love’ bit!!! The build powers up in 15 seconds and powers down in 5 seconds. The in-built WiFi works well, even though one of the antennae is loose - I’d have to take the mobo out of the case to tighten the nut!Although I’ve not given it a stern test, it performs all the ordinary tasks effortlessly and shows every sign that it could allow my R5 CPU to fly!!!One last thing; the BIOS for this board isn’t on the MSI UK list - you have to get it from the MSI US list!!! As I said at the start - a love/hate relationship!!!
